ants.name: Little Black Ant
ants.description: Little black ants are also known as black pharaoh ants!

ants.name: Fire Ant
ants.description: Fire ants are an invasive species, and they are also called red imported fire ants (RIFA).

spiders.name: Black Widow Spider
spiders.description: Western black widow spiders are considered to be the most venomous spider in North America, but their bites are not commonly fatal.

spiders.name: Yellow Garden Spider
spiders.description: Yellow garden spiders are a species of orb-weaver spiders, due to their circular webs.

beetles.name: Sacred Scarab
beetles.description: In Ancient Egypt, the sacred scarab was a symbol for Kephri, who represented the morning sun.

beetles.name: Seven-spotted Ladybug
beetles.description: Seven-spotted ladybugs can be found anywhere that has aphids, their primary food source.

mantids.name: Praying Mantis
mantids.description: When mating, female praying mantises eat their mate for nutrients so they do not have to hunt.

mantids.name: Pink Orchid Mantis
mantids.description: Being ambush predators, some mantids evolved to mimic flowers as a better form of camouflage.

isopods.name: Roly-Poly
isopods.description: Roly-Polies, also known as pillbugs, roll up into a ball as a form of self-defense.

gastropods.name: Garden Snail
gastropods.description: A snail's shell is essential its survival. Snails are born with them, grow with them, and even repair them.
